snippet: Apple has confirmed that it has acquired Anobit, an Israeli maker of flash storage technology, CNet says.
abstract: Apple has confirmed that it has acquired Anobit, an Israeli maker of flash storage technology, CNet says.
lead_paragraph: Apple has confirmed that it has acquired Anobit, an Israeli maker of flash storage technology, CNet says. The terms were not disclosed, but the price has been estimated to be between $400 million and $500 million, which would make it one of Apple's biggest acquisitions. Read more »
